column5: Anyone know if a person with a MIP would be denied crossing the Canadian border?
Hi. maybe if you decode MIP folks will respond!
Mortgage Insurance Premium? Most Improved Player? Management Incentive Program? Moon Impact Probe? Mobile Internet Protocol? Or. . . . . I'm guessing . . . . . Minor In Possession?
I'm guessing that it stands for Minor in Possession; typically a misdemeanor. If there were no felony charges you should be okay. Check here for more info: http://www.cbsa-asfc.gc.ca/menu-eng.html
If it is a felony in Canada, you will be denied entry Could be a misdemeanor in US and a felony in Canada
It stands for minor in possession. It means being caught with alcohol before the legal drinking age.
I was caught and fined for underage drinking 20yrs ago and they let me in every year
